item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, March 25, 2025 at 6:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Stoop Coffee: How a Simple Idea Transformed My Neighborhood (155 points | 44 comments)
2. Kylie Minogue song about a typeface (55 points | 24 comments)
3. Gemini 2.5: Our most intelligent AI model (183 points | 86 comments)
4. Prospero challenge, now with more garbage collection (8 points | discuss)
5. Why is C the symbol for the speed of light? (2004) (72 points | 45 comments)
6. VGGT: Visual Geometry Grounded Transformer (95 points | 28 comments)
7. Borne Back Ceaselessly into the Past: Fitzgerald, Gatsby and WWI (25 points | 4 comments)
8. 4o Image Generation (15 points | 3 comments)
9. Activeloop (YC S18) Is Hiring Senior Python Back End and AI Search Engineers ( | hide)
10. The Jakt Programming Language (53 points | 10 comments)
11. There are perhaps 10k reasons to doubt Oracle Cloud's security breach denial (20 points | discuss)
12. My Favorite C++ Pattern: X Macros (2023) (43 points | 33 comments)
13. Were large soda lakes the cradle of life? (16 points | 5 comments)
14. German parliament votes as a Git contribution graph (550 points | 153 comments)
15. Hann: A Fast Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search Library for Go (53 points | 6 comments)
16. Nearly half of Canadians have cut cable entirely: report (5 points | discuss)
17. How 'animal methods bias' is affecting research careers (10 points | discuss)
18. Search My Site – open-source search engine for personal and independent websites (221 points | 49 comments)
19. Polypane, The browser for ambitious web developers (112 points | 79 comments)
20. BBC – Organizing music for organic discovery (15 points | 2 comments)
21. Reflecting on WikiTok (132 points | 32 comments)
22. A study reveals that deciduous trees' roots remain active in winter (57 points | 24 comments)
23. Bitcoin in the bush – the crypto mine in remote Zambia (10 points | 1 comment)
24. New NASA satellite mapped the oceans like never before (30 points | 5 comments)
25. The Lost Towers of the Guelph-Ghibelline Wars (96 points | 31 comments)
26. Writing your own C++ standard library from scratch (126 points | 100 comments)
27. Spammers are better at SPF, DKIM, and DMARC than everyone else (339 points | 181 comments)
28. Samsung CEO Jong-hee Han has died (225 points | 119 comments)
29. Qwen2.5-VL-32B: Smarter and Lighter (520 points | 280 comments)
30. Three Hundred Years Later, a Tool from Isaac Newton Gets an Update (141 points | 37 comments)
